俄羅斯主權網路法生效 數位鐵幕恐加速成形
03 Nov 2019, 16:42 by https://www.facebook.com/cnanewstaiwan, 中央通訊社
（中央社莫斯科2日綜合外電報導）俄羅斯備受爭議的新法「主權網路法」（sovereign internet）昨天生效，網路自由會不會就此走味，讓數位鐵幕更加速成形，科技公司和網路用戶都在密切關注。
美國有線電視新聞網（CNN）報導，俄國早對網路設下重重限制，總統蒲亭（Vladimir Putin）今年稍早把相關規定簽署成法律，允許成立自外於全球的國家網路；這條法律也允許「俄羅斯國家資訊科技、通訊及大眾傳媒監察機構」（Roskomnadzor）關閉外部網路交流，創造「純俄」網路。
俄國政府先前表示，這種種規定都是為了保護國家，培養即便外國勢力干預，也能維續國家網路的能力。
官方「俄羅斯日報」（Rossiiskaya Gazeta）表示，「主權網路法」不致影響網路用戶，但會「確保俄國網路在遭受威脅時的溝通能力」。
官方邏輯淺顯易懂，但批評者警告，由於「主權網路法」要求所有網路提供者安裝「俄羅斯國家資訊科技、通訊及大眾傳媒監察機構」的特殊軟體，恐讓俄國政府更易監測、重新導向與關閉網路，也更容易阻擋政治敏感內容。（譯者：鄭詩韻/核稿：陳政一）1081103

The legality of the Russian sovereign network law
03 Nov 2019, 16:42 by https://www.facebook.com/cnanewstaiwan, Central News Agency
(Central News Agency, Moscow, 2nd comprehensive foreign news report) Russia's controversial new law "sovereign internet law" (sovereign internet law) took effect yesterday, will Internet freedom be taken off, and the digital iron curtain will be accelerated, technology companies and networks Road users are paying close attention.
CNN reported that Russia had set a heavy restrictions on the Internet, and President Vladimir Putin signed the law into law earlier this year, allowing the establishment of a national network from outside the world; The law also allows the “Russian National Information Technology, Communications and Mass Media Inspectorate” (Roskomnadzor) to close external network communications and create a “pure Russian” network.
The Russian government has previously stated that such regulations are designed to protect the country and foster the ability to maintain the national network even if foreign forces intervene.
The official "Russian Daily" (Rossiiskaya Gazeta) said that the "Sovereign Internet Law" would not affect Internet users, but would "ensure the ability of the Russian network to communicate when threatened."
The official logic is easy to understand, but critics warn that the "Sovereign Internet Law" requires all Internet providers to install the special software of the "Russian National Information Technology, Communications and Mass Media Inspectorate", which may make it easier for the Russian government to monitor and re- It is also easier to block politically sensitive content by directing and shutting down the network. (Translator: Zheng Shiyun / Nuclear Manuscript: Chen Zhengyi) 1081103
